field_edited_text.value:
Pier 4 Power Plant - Renovated as a family entertainment center by Six Flags Corp.

In addition to these projects that have
been announced, there are additional oppor-
tunities for industrial development around
the port. Canton, Locust Point, and Fairfield
contain a limited number of available sites,
usually under 30 acres. Hawkins Point, with
over 400 acres of undeveloped land, offers a
substantial opportunity for new industrial
and/or maritime related development. If all
400 acres were developed at an average of
12 employees per acre, almost 5,000 new
jobs would result. This opportunity, coupled
with the development of other smaller par-
cels around the harbor and the announced
projects, presents the potential of produc-
ing over 10,000 new industrial and maritime
jobs around the port by the year 2000. This
would constitute a significant contribution
to the City’s employment base.

Residential and Commercial Development:

The redevelopment of the Inner
Harbor has rekindled the public’s interest
in the waterfront as a place to spend time,
shop, and live. While not nearly as exten-
sive as the other types of economic activity
around the harbor, the residential and
commercial development occurring and
expected in the the Inner Harbor, Fells
Point, and Falls Harbor areas is important in



that it represents significant additional
private investment in the rehabilitation of
the City. The activity has generated a new
national, and local, interest in Baltimore as
a place to visit and live.

Several waterfront redevelopment projects
are likely in the future:

Pier 4 Power Plant - In late December,
1982, the City announced that it had
selected the Six Flags Corp. as developers
of the Pier 4 Power Plant. The Power Plant
will be an amusement center including
rides, attractions, a museum, theaters,
shops, and restaurants drawing on the turn-
of-the century as its main theme to open in
1985.

Inner Harbor East - Piers 5 and 6 and
the area east of the Jones Falls, known as
Falls Harbor, has tremendous potential for
future development to attract visitors. With
Little Italy immediately adjacent to the area,
develoﬁ{\ent could build on international
attractions and include a public waterfront
promenade, marina, plaza, and specialized
commercial uses.

Fells Point - Old warehouses are being
converted to condominiums and new town-
houses are being built on the waterfront in



31
